intro: Thymophylla greggii var. radiata, commonly known as Gregg's thymophylla, is a succulent plant native to the southwestern United States. It belongs to the Aizoaceae family and is characterized by its fleshy, ribbed stems and small, clustered leaves. The plant produces vibrant yellow to orange flowers during the spring and summer months. It thrives in well-draining soil and full sun, making it suitable for arid and semi-arid environments. Due to its unique appearance and adaptability, it is often cultivated as an ornamental plant in desert gardens.
